note.p: Education: Padua; MD; Incorporated at Oxford

Career: Travelled throughout the Ottoman Empire; practised in Constantinople; after taking part in the negotiations for the Peace of Carlowitz (1699), he travelled to England with the English representative, William, Lord Paget; returned to Constantinople (1703); he described the practice of inoculation against smallpox as practised in the Ottoman Empire in a letter to John Woodward (FRS 1693); committed suicide
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; Hirsch; Biog Univ
References: Raymond Phineas Stearns, 'Fellows of the Royal Society in North Africa and the Levant, 1662-1800' in NR 1954-55 vol 11 pp 75-90
Notes: Hirsch and Biog Univ say he was Greek, but N&R article says he was born in Italy and gives date of death as c 1718
